poem:
**Final Act**  

Beneath the marionette sky,  
players dance on strings of dread;  
shadows in the oracle's eye,  
what scripts have yet to be read?  
Beneath masks of porcelain smiles,  
hope's a fading, fragile thread;  
curtains fall in a grim exile,  
leaving echoes of the dead.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘What’s the world’s best actor doing there?’ The real reason the Squid Game finale is so bleak Spoiler warning: before we start, I need to make it clear that I’m about to discuss the ending of Squid Game. If you haven’t seen it yet, stop reading now. But if you have seen it, my goodness – what the hell just happened? We knew the signs weren’t great going into the final season. Prior to its". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
